newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy mini-budget goes to parliamentary commission.
newsitem.headline: Italy mini-budget goes to parliamentary commission.

text.p: The Italian government's controversial mini-budget passed to the budget commission of the Chamber of Deputies (lower house) on Tuesday, parliamentary sources said.

The package, containing 15.5 trillion lire of deficit cuts, was approved by the centre-left cabinet last Thursday and is designed to plug a hole in Italy's state accounts and keep it on course to join Europe's single currency at the 1999 launch.
But the budget, which includes measures forcing firms to pay taxes on huge severance payment funds two years ahead of time, has been slammed by opposition politicians and industrialists.
Economists have also criticised it as a stop gap, lacking the structural changes that the government had promised.
Parliamentary sources said the budget commission could fix the timetable for examination of the package at its first meeting on Wednesday.
